body:
This seems going backwards to manual memory management
and it complicated the runtime a lot. I don't like this idea.

As mentioned in another issue, the GC could do a stop the world
emergency collection when memory runs out, and it should help
the usual case where there still is free memory available but GC
has yet to claim them.

If the program indeed runs out of memory, then it isn't much that
the panic handler could do to remedy the situation.
